Class AveragingFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Filter<java.lang.Double>
      • ScalarFilter
        • AveragingFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericFilter<java.lang.Double>

    public class AveragingFilter
extends ScalarFilter
    AveragingFilter extends Filter, enforcing a double input and keeping track of the number of inputs there has been. It simple overrides the processInput function such that the next output is set to be the average. This is simple arithemetic: size++; average = (((average * (size - 1)) + input) / size);
    Author:
    gmh73

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AveragingFilter()
      Constructs an Averaging Filter with initial size 0 and initial average 0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void processInput(java.lang.Double input)
      The new average is calculated and outputted
      void reset(java.lang.Double r)
      The default reset for averaging filter is to set the average to r and set the size to 1
      void reset(java.lang.Double r, int i)
      An alternate reset function sets the average to r and the size to i.

      • reset

        public void reset(java.lang.Double r,
         int i)
        An alternate reset function sets the average to r and the size to i. The previous output remains the same.
        Parameters:
        r - the average
        i - the size
